Reports to: Head, PMO

Job Overview


	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented PMO Analyst (3&ndash;5 years) to support the PMO in driving project governance, performance reporting, and operational excellence.
	The role will work closely with project managers and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure projects are well-planned, well-documented, and aligned with strategic objectives.
	You will be responsible for maintaining project documentation, tracking project KPIs, preparing dashboards, coordinating governance meetings, and supporting continuous improvement initiatives across the organisation.
	This position requires strong analytical ability, excellent communication skills, and a proactive approach to problem solving.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the development, implementation, and maintenance of PMO frameworks, standards, and templates.
	Provide analytical, administrative, and coordination support to project managers throughout the project lifecycle.
	Prepare and present project and portfolio-level performance reports, dashboards, and KPIs.
	Facilitate project governance meetings, including scheduling, agenda preparation, and minute-taking.
	Ensure accuracy, completeness, and proper archiving of all project documentation.
	Track project timelines, budgets, and deliverables, escalating deviations as required.
	Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives within the PMO to enhance processes, tools, and working methods.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Project Management, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in a PMO Analyst, Project Analyst, or similar role.
	Solid understanding of project management methodologies and governance practices.
	Advanced proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint; familiarity with project management tools (e.g., MS Project, Monday.com, Asana) is an advantage.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work with senior stakeholders.
	Ability to work independently, multitask, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;cynthia.onuoha@idyha.com&nbsp;with the Job Posiiton as the Subject of the email.

PMO Analyst Job at DYHA Capital




        
    

        
        At IDYHA Capital we believe in the immense potential of regions businesses and partner with exceptional management teams to help them thrive. We identify and address critical gaps that hinder business growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: PMO Analyst

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Head, PMO

Job Overview

	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented PMO Analyst (3–5 years) to support the PMO in driving project governance, performance reporting, and operational excellence.
	The role will work closely with project managers and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure projects are well-planned, well-documented, and aligned with strategic objectives.
	You will be responsible for maintaining project documentation, tracking project KPIs, preparing dashboards, coordinating governance meetings, and supporting continuous improvement initiatives across the organisation.
	This position requires strong analytical ability, excellent communication skills, and a proactive approach to problem solving.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the development, implementation, and maintenance of PMO frameworks, standards, and templates.
	Provide analytical, administrative, and coordination support to project managers throughout the project lifecycle.
	Prepare and present project and portfolio-level performance reports, dashboards, and KPIs.
	Facilitate project governance meetings, including scheduling, agenda preparation, and minute-taking.
	Ensure accuracy, completeness, and proper archiving of all project documentation.
	Track project timelines, budgets, and deliverables, escalating deviations as required.
	Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives within the PMO to enhance processes, tools, and working methods.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Project Management, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in a PMO Analyst, Project Analyst, or similar role.
	Solid understanding of project management methodologies and governance practices.
	Advanced proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint; familiarity with project management tools (e.g., MS Project, Monday.com, Asana) is an advantage.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work with senior stakeholders.
	Ability to work independently, multitask, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: cynthia.onuoha@idyha.com with the Job Posiiton as the Subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.
